sentence.text: Lynch syndrome (LS) patients with isolated mismatch repair loss in the colon cancer, while intact MMR in the prostate cancer, are exceedingly rare.

Immunostaining showed that the colon cancer was positive for negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II, negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II, had a loss of mismatch repair and intact expression of mismatch repair, DNA repair and DNA repair, negative for bile acid metabolic process, while the prostate cancer was positive for AMACR, had intact expression of PMS2, MLH1, MSH2 and MSH6, and negative for CDX2 and SATB2.

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II
negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: MSI-H phenotype and mismatch repair mutation in the colon cancer were confirmed by microsatellite instability (MSI) PCR and next-generation sequencing (NGS), respectively.

To the best of our knowledge, this is the first documented case of synchronous colon and prostate cancers, with isolated mismatch repair loss present in the colon cancer while intact DNA mismatch repair (MMR) protein expressions present in the prostate cancer, in the English literature.
